description:
"To be quiet and do as you're told, that's the cowardly choice." These are the words of Junk Dog, an underground fighter of Megalo Box, an evolution of boxing that utilizes mechanical limbs known as Gear to enhance the speed and power of its users. Despite the young man's brimming potential as a boxer, the illegal nature of his participation forces him to make a living off of throwing matches as dictated by his boss Gansaku Nanbu. However, this all changes when the Megalo Box champion Yuuri enters his shabby ring under the guise of just another challenger. Taken out in a single round, Junk Dog is left with a challenge: "If you're serious about fighting me again, then fight your way up to me and my ring."

Filled with overwhelming excitement and backed by the criminal syndicate responsible for his thrown matches, Junk Dog enters Megalonia: a world-spanning tournament that will decide the strongest Megalo Boxer of them all. Having no name of his own, he takes on the moniker of "Joe" as he begins his climb from the very bottom of the ranked list of fighters. With only three months left to qualify, Joe must face off against opponents the likes of which he has never fought in order to meet the challenge of his rival.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

node.description:
Asaki Takamori, better known by this pen names Ikki Kajiwara and Asao Takamori, was a Japanese author, manga writer, and film producer. He is known for series about sports and martial arts. He considered [Tiger Mask](https://anilist.co/manga/60575/) and [Kyojin no Hoshi](https://anilist.co/manga/45305/) to be his life's work.

Formerly married to [Bingbing Pai](https://anilist.co/staff/256250) from 1979 to 1981.

[Website](http://www.chibapro.co.jp/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/chibatetsu/)

A Japanese manga artist famous for his sports stories.

He was born in Chuo, Tokyo, Japan, but lived most of his early childhood in Shenyang, Liaoning when northeast China was colonized by Japan during the Second Sino-Japanese War. His father was working in a paper factory when they lived in China. Two of his younger brothers are manga artists: Akio Chiba and Shigeyuki Chiba (pen name Taro Nami), who is almost completely unknown outside Japan, despite writing many popular sports manga in Japan. Chiba's works include _Ashita no Joe_, his best known work, and _Notari Matsutarou_. Many of his early titles are still in print due to continued popularity.

Designer, director, and animator originally from [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11). He made his directorial debut in 2018 with [Megalo Box](https://anilist.co/anime/100298). Frequently works with [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088).

[Website](http://mabanua.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mabanua) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mabanuainsta/) | [SoundCloud](https://soundcloud.com/mabanua) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCoSiocInTZENuu7LGqrhfwg) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/mabanua.official/)

Manabu Yamaguchi, better known by his stage name Mabanua, is a Japanese composer, producer, musician, and singer out of many things. He is currently associated with Origami PRODUCTIONS. Also the drummer for the band Ovall.
Ishikawa Shingo (石川晋吾) is a Japanese animator, animation supervisor, animation director and character designer.

Designer, director, and animator originally from [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11). He made his directorial debut in 2018 with [Megalo Box](https://anilist.co/anime/100298). Frequently works with [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088).

Designer, director, and animator originally from [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11). He made his directorial debut in 2018 with [Megalo Box](https://anilist.co/anime/100298). Frequently works with [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088).

Designer, director, and animator originally from [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11). He made his directorial debut in 2018 with [Megalo Box](https://anilist.co/anime/100298). Frequently works with [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chororoles) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/chororoles/)

A Mexican voice actor. He is known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Mordecai in _Regular Show_ and James Gordon in _Gotham_.

He's the father of [Abril Gómez](https://anilist.co/staff/203264/Abril-Gmez).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Chom2Start)  |  [SOUL OF JOE (fansite)](http://soulofjoe.jp/index.html)

Currently working for Studio M2.

He's an Ashita no Joe ''collector'' and fan and has contributed to books, TV programs, museums and more. He is also an administrator of the fansite ''SOUL OF JOE''.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/giselleando/) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/giselle.ando)

Giselle Ando is a Brazilian actress, voice actress and dubbing director.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大野広司)

1977, he joined Kobayashi Production, where he studied under [Shichirou Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/103964/). In 1982, he debuted as an art director on [Tonde Mon Pe](https://anilist.co/anime/6730/), and soon after that he left Kobayashi Production and took part in the founding of Studio Fuga with [Hiromasa Ogura](https://anilist.co/staff/105312/) and [Toshiharu Mizutani](https://anilist.co/staff/121908/). Later became, and is the current representative director of the studio.
